title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
The response should include supporting work for the numerical answer of −1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaIXaGaaiOlaa aa@358E@

descriptions: The student response does not accurately include a correct value.
The student response accurately includes a correct value.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The first point is earned for a correct expression for f ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9Lq pC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaa biGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadAgacaaMi8+aaeWaaeaaca WG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3B4D@ OR evidence of correct use of FTC in determining the appropriate f ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9Lq pC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaa biGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadAgacaaMi8+aaeWaaeaaca WG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3B4D@ values for consideration.

For the second point: The response may also consider x=6, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGOnai aacYcaaaa@36A7@ though this is not required in order to justify an absolute minimum value or an absolute maximum value on the interval.

For the third and fourth points: At most 1 out of 2 points is earned for supporting work that justifies a correct absolute minimum value OR absolute maximum value based on a Candidates Test with a maximum of one arithmetic error.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes three of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all four of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
A response with any errors, including omission of the constant of integration, does not earn the point.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include a correct answer.
The student response accurately includes a correct answer.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
To earn the second point, a response must present a definite integral that correctly handles the substitution of the limits of integration. Correct handling of the reversal of the limits of integration and all calculations are part of the third point.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student accurately includes all three of the criteria below.
